isis.stitle: 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14613 - DISASSEMBLE - INTEGRAL OIL PUMP

step1.para: Remove the integral oil pump retainer plate from the case ( Figure 123).

figure.caption: Figure 123. Remove Integral Oil Pump Retainer Plate

step1.para: Remove the outer oil pump element from the pump ( Figure 124).

figure.caption: Figure 124. Remove Outer Oil Pump Element From Pump

step1.para: Remove the drive gear retaining snap ring from the drive shaft ( Figure 125).

figure.caption: Figure 125. Remove Drive Gear Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Remove the drive gear from the pump drive shaft ( Figure 126).

figure.caption: Figure 126. Remove Drive Gear From Pump Drive Shaft

step1.para: Remove the key from the drive shaft keyway ( Figure 127).

figure.caption: Figure 127. Remove Key From Drive Shaft Keyway

step1.para: Remove the element retaining snap ring from the drive shaft ( Figure 128).

figure.caption: Figure 128. Remove Element Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Remove the internal oil pump element from the drive shaft ( Figure 129).

figure.caption: Figure 129. Remove Internal Oil Pump Element

step1.para: Remove the two keys from the drive shaft keyways ( Figure 130).

figure.caption: Figure 130. Remove Keys From Drive Shaft Keyways

step1.para: Remove the drive shaft from the integral oil pump housing ( Figure 131).

figure.caption: Figure 131. Remove Drive Shaft From Integral Oil Pump Housing

step1.para: Remove the relief valve roll pin from the pump housing ( Figure 132). The relief valve spring can now be removed from the relief valve housing bore ( inset, Figure 132).

figure.caption: Figure 132. Remove Relief Valve Roll Pin and Relief Valve Spring

step1.para: Remove the relief valve from the housing bore ( Figure 133).

figure.caption: Figure 133. Remove Relief Valve From Housing Bore

step1.para: If necessary, the front case plug can be removed from the case by driving the plug through the front of the case ( Figure 134). Remove the O-ring from the O.D. of the plug if necessary.

figure.caption: Figure 134. Drive Front Case Plug Through Front of Case
